From: Louis Seidman Sent: Saturday, February 13, 2016 10:02 PM Subject: Re: Justice Scalia Our norms of civility preclude criticizing public figures immediately after their death. In my mind, he was not a "giant" in any sense. I don't want to teach our students to hold Scalia in reverence. The "Georgetown Community" is a lived community of tolerance, affection, and care that so many have built for so long here. That "community" would never have claimed that it mourns the loss of J. It would be a sad day if, as an institution, we were incapable of honoring important public figures upon their death simply because we disagree with the positions they took.
